chapter.title: SAP Product Installation
chapter.para: This section will guide you through the installation of SAP media kits you received from SAP.

sect1.title: First Steps
sect1.para: These first steps are only relevant during the installation workflow.

step.para: When the system has booted, you will be presented with the screen Welcome. Proceed with Next.
The screen Network Settings will now open. This gives you another chance to change the network settings.
When you are finished configuring networking, proceed with Next.

important.title: Configure Networking as Recommended by SAP
important.para: Make sure to configure the network connection as recommended by the documentation of your SAP application.

step.para:
For details regarding network configuration, see
&admin;, Chapter 19 Basic Networking, Section 19.4 Configuring a Network Connection with YaST (&docaddress;).
(While the next screen loads, the Welcome screen may appear again for a few seconds.)
step.remark: It does appear for around 8s for me which makes you wonder a bit as a user. - sknorr, 2016-01-25

step.para: You can now choose how to continue:

term.guimenu: Create SAP file systems and start SAP product installation

listitem.para: Allows installing an SAP product or setting up the system as a server providing SAP installation routines to other systems.

term.guimenu: Only create SAP HANA file systems, do not install SAP products now

listitem.remark: For whatever reason there is no way out after clicking Next. You click OK twice and suddenly, there is a/no HANA fs. Reported as bsc#962755, bsc#962757 - sknorr, 2016-01-14
Create a procedure for HANA fs creation? According to varkoly, it just does stuff and you can't do much anyway. (Which matches up with what happens on unsupported hardware too.) - sknorr, 2016-01-28

important.title: Use Hardware Certified for &hana;
important.para: To use this functionality, your hardware needs to be certified for &hana;. Otherwise, this option will not create a new file system and the installation workflow ends at this point.

listitem.remark: Next steps: click Next, click OK, click Finish

term.guimenu: Finish wizard and proceed to OS login

listitem.para: Do not install an SAP application and continue to the login screen of &sles4sap;.
listitem.remark: Next steps: click Next, click Finish

step.para: Proceed with Next.

tip.title: Installing an SAP Product in a Fully Installed System
tip.para: This process is documented as it appears during the installation workflow. However, there is a functionally equivalent &yast; dialog available within the installed system. It has a different color scheme and lacks the left pane.
To start it, from the desktop, choose ApplicationsSystem YaST, continue in the &yast; control center by choosing Miscellaneous SAP Product Installer.

tip.title: SAP Product Installer Configuration
tip.remark: Terminology: "SAP Product Installer" and "SAP Installation Wizard" are pretty close. Maybe SUSE should change the wizard's name some time in the future..? - sknorr, 2016-01-15
tip.para: The SAP Product Installer configuration are specified and documented in /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard. You can change them according to your needs.

step.para: In the screen SAP Installation Wizard, provide the Location of the SAP Installation Master (). The location can either be a local, removable, or remote installation source.
Select the corresponding option from the drop-down box. In the text box, specify the path to your source according to the format given in the following table.

para.remark: This is correct: the relevant files are usually at the top level which is //. - sknorr, 2016-01-20

tip.title: Remote Location Specification
tip.para: To install from an NFS source, enter the name of the server and the complete path to the media data. For more information about setting up a remote installation server, see .

step.para: If you have installed from an installation server before or set up your system to be an installation server, you can also directly choose that server as the provider of the &instmaster;. To do so, use the drop-down box below Choose an installation master.
Under Advanced Options, choose from among the following options:

term.guimenu: Collect installation profiles but do not execute installation

listitem.para: Use this option if you only want to set the installation parameters, but not perform the actual installation. If you choose this option, the installation will continue as it would without this option but the &sapin; (&sapina;) will stop earlier. However, the following steps fully apply.

term.guimenu: Link to the installation master without copying its content to local location (SAP NetWeaver only)

listitem.para: Use this option to avoid copying an &instmaster; from one local location to another. This option is only active when the drop-down box above is set to dir://.

term.guimenu: Serve all installation media (including master) to local network via NFS

listitem.para: Set up this system as an installation server for other &sles4sap; systems. The media copied to this installation server will be offered through Service Location Protocol (SLP).

step.para: Proceed with Next.
The &sapwiz; will now copy the &instmaster; to your local hard disk.

step.remark: From here on out, we're NetWeaver-only... Branch this procedure...? - sknorr, 2016-02-02
step.para: You will now see the screen What Would You Like to Install. Under The SAP product is, choose how you want to install the product:
step.remark: Refe to the Help button and remove (as in old guide)? - sknorr, 2016

listitem.para: Engines that add functionality to a standard product.
listitem.remark: Why is "engines" in plural? This is certainly not a typo, it was the same way before the redesign. - sknorr, 2016-01-15

listitem.para: A product that is separated onto multiple servers.
listitem.remark: UI inconsistency? Why is this not called "SAP Distributed System"? - sknorr, 2016-01-15

listitem.para: Installation of &netweaver; in a high-availability setup.
Allows changing the various system properties such as the SAP system ID, database ID, instance number or host name.
listitem.remark: Should this be a different procedure? - sknorr, 2016-01-15
Does this even make sense within the installer? Ask varkoly. Maybe this point should be hidden during first-boot. - sknorr, 2016-01-20

step.para: If you selected SAP Standard System, Distributed System, or SAP High-Availability System, additionally choose a back-end database under The back-end database system is.
Proceed with Next.

step.remark: What are the other cases? Ask varkoly. - sknorr, 2016-01-20
step.para: You will now see the screen Choose a Product. The products shown depend on the &mediaset; and &instmaster; you received from SAP. From the list, choose the product you want to install.
Proceed with Next.
On the screen SAP Installation Wizard, you can provide the location of additional &instmedia; you want to install. This can include, for example an SAP kernel, a database, and database exports.

listitem.para: Provide a path to additional &instmedia;. For more information on how to enter the path, see .
When providing a local path (dir://), you can additionally choose to only link to the &instmedia;.
Do not copy additional &instmedia;. Choose this option if you do not need additional &instmedia; or if you want to install additional &instmedia; directly from their source.
When choosing this option despite your SAP product requiring additional &instmedia;, you will later need to provide the SAP Installer (SAPinst) with the relevant paths.
listitem.remark: Is this option somehow recommended/useful for any particular case? - sknorr, 2016-02-03

step.para: Proceed with Next.
If you chose to copy &instmedia;, the &sapwiz; will then copy the relevant files to your local hard disk.

step.remark: Actually, I am being asked whether I want to prepare more media... However, either you copy or bust. Check if we should fix the usage of "prepare". - sknorr, 2016-02-03
step.para: After copying the &instmedia;, you will be asked whether you want to copy more &instmedia;. To do so, click Yes. After doing so, follow the instructions in .
Otherwise, click No.
You will be asked whether you want to copy Supplementary or Third-Party Media. To do so, click Yes. After doing so, follow the instructions in .
Otherwise, click No.
For information on creating &supmedia;, see .
step.remark: Two crossrefs in one step. Not ideal. - sknorr, 2016-02-03

step.para: On the screen Additional software repositories for your SAP installation, you can add further software repositories. This can be useful, for example for installing add-ons that are packaged as RPM. To do so, click Add new software repositories. For more information on adding repositories, see Deployment Guide, Chapter 8 Installing and Removing Software, Section 8.3.1 Adding Software Repositories (&docaddress;).
Proceed with Next.

note.title: Location of Copied SAP Media
note.para: At this point, all data required for the SAP installation should have been copied to /data/SAP_CDs (unless you chose to skip the process of copying). Each Installation Medium is copied to a separate directory. You might find the following directory structure, for example:
/data/SAP_CDs is the default directory as specified in the /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard configuration file.

step.para: In SAP System Parameters, select the appropriate System T-Shirt Sizing.
Proceed with OK.
In the following dialog, choose the appropriate network settings for your system.

important.title: Configure Networking as Recommended by SAP
important.para: Make sure to configure the network connection as recommended in the documentation provided to you by SAP.

step.para: Proceed with OK.
The &sapwiz; will now download some additional software packages.
Now the actual installation of the SAP system can be performed using the the &sapin; (&sapina;). Depending on your system, it can take a while until &sapin; is ready.
Follow the steps of &sapin; as described in the documentation provided to you by SAP.
On the screen Tune your system for optimal performance, you can choose a tuning option for your system. Normally, the best option is preselected and you do not need to change the Profile name.
Proceed with Next, then click OK.
step.remark: Help recommends using sapconf "in combination with" tuned to change this later on. Need to put that here? - sknorr, 2016-02-02

step.para: The final screen is Installation Completed.

To create an &ay; file for this installation, activate Clone This System for AutoYaST. The &ay; file will be placed in /root/autoinst.xml and will overwrite &ay; files created earlier in the same location.
Proceed with Finish.

sect1.title: Continuing an Installation Using an Installation Profile
sect1.remark: Any previous run or just the last one? - sknorr, 2016-01-27
sect1.para: If you chose Collect installation profiles but do not execute installation during a previous run of the &sapwiz;, this section will show you how to continue the installation of the selected SAP applications.
When collecting an installation profile, the &sapwiz; copies product images to /data/SAP_CDs. It also prepares an installation environment for every product under the path /data/SAP_INST:
To continue the installation, follow the below steps:

step.para: In /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard, set the following:
In the case of an &hana;/&b1; installation, the &sapwiz; will later use the parameters documented in the &ay; files in /data/SAP_INST/number.
If you need to change any parameters, make sure to adapt the &ay; files at this point.
Open the &yast; control center and start SAP Product Installer.

step.remark: This question appears whether the SAP_AUTO_INSTALL=yes or not. However, if not, all questions will be asked again. There seems to be partial state at least, in that the installer remembers what is already copied. Could be luck. - sknorr, 2016-02-03
step.para: You will be asked whether to continue the pending installation. Select Install.
All further interactions happen within the &sapin;. Follow the steps of &sapin; as described in the documentation provided to you by SAP.

listitem.para: In the case of an &netweaver; installation, all parameter of the &sapin; will be offered again for fine-tuning.
In the case of an &hana;/&b1; installation, the installation will not be offering to make any changes to parameters.
